Pappy & The Pards - Cosmic Country & Bluegrass Thursdays in Feb!

Thursday, February 1, 2018

9:30PM

Nectar's

Burlington, VT

9
154625651831106

Pappy & The Pards - Cosmic Country & Bluegrass Thursdays in Feb!

Thursday, February 1, 2018 9:30PM - Friday, February 23, 2018 1:30AM

Sponsored by Switchback Brewing Company Pappy & The Pards - Cosmic Country & Bluegrass: Every Thursday in February ft. special guests ~~~~~~~~~~ 9:30pm doors 18+ $7 ~~~~~~~~~~ Pappy and the Pards is a musical outfit led by Pappy Biondo (Cabinet). The Pards consist of an evolving cast of musicians that he has met and made music with through out his years as a touring artist. For this residency Pappy, and the Pards, will be delivering a bi-weekly showcase of bluegrass and cosmic country music. Original and covered. Acoustic and electric. Far out and close to home. Just think Cabinet meets, Ralph Stanley meets, The New Riders of the Purple Sage meets, JJ Cale, meet Bill Monroe. These Thursdays are sure to take you to a musical place you've never been before but also bring you home safe with the sounds of old. Feb 1 - Grass Matt Flinner - mandolin Doug Perkins- guitar Caleb Elder - fiddle Pat Melvin - bass Russ Lawton - drums Feb 8 - Cosmic Country/JJ Cale set Justin Mazer - guitar Russ Lawton - drums Dylan Skursky - bass Ray Paczkowski - keys Feb15 - Grass Doug Perkins - guitar Adam Frehm - dobro Pat Melvin - bass Patrick Ross - fiddle Matt Schragg - mandolin Feb 22 - Cosmic Country/JJ Cale set Gordon Stone - pedal steel Sean Preece - drums Pat Melvin - bass Justin Mazer - guitar

Justin Panigutti Solo - Wednesdays in February at Nectar's

Wednesday, February 7, 2018

7:00PM

Nectar's

Burlington, VT

9
1839336026097950

Justin Panigutti Solo - Wednesdays in February at Nectar's

Wednesday, February 7, 2018 7:00PM - Wednesday, February 28, 2018 9:00PM

7-9pm Free, all ages ~~~~~~~~~~~~ Justin Panigutti Throughout the course of my musical career, I have learned three life lessons that continue to instruct and direct my actions, as I navigate the ever changing waters of life: Music is and always will be my home. Be it a garage, vehicle, stage, field, porch, kitchen line‚Ä¶ No matter what we do or where we go, music follows us. So, I guess I‚Äôm always at home. Music and its frequency is extremely powerful. It can, and will, change the world for the better. Not on some cheesy, hippy dippy level, in reality. No doubt. I am deeply humbled to be a part of the musical community to which I call home. So long as there is good music and ample love in the world I have nothing to fear. Drawing from this knowledge, I am committed to creating and performing music with feeling. If you can‚Äôt feel music, then you‚Äôre just hearing things. Whether leading a big band, my own band, or performing a solo show, I am always at home knowing I am on stage with all my friends. Every performance I take on is a true depiction of me and my craft and how I connect with my fellow musicians and audiences.

BIG Something w/ Formula 5 at Westcott Theater, Syracuse, NY

Wednesday, February 14, 2018

7:00PM

The Westcott Theater

Syracuse, NY

9
280291469163347

BIG Something w/ Formula 5 at Westcott Theater, Syracuse, NY

Wednesday, February 14, 2018 7:00PM - Wednesday, February 14, 2018 10:00PM

BIG Something w/ special guests Formula 5, & Haewa All Ages Show Tickets available at: http://bit.ly/2Cd4FGr $12 advance/ $15 day of show A 6 piece powerhouse with a sound that is both unique and timeless, BIG Something fuses elements of rock, pop, funk, and improvisation to take listeners on a journey through a myriad of musical styles. It's no secret why this group has quickly become one of the most exciting new bands to emerge from the Southeast. Soaring guitars, synths, horns and alluring vocal hooks rise to the top of their infectious collection of songs and represent a sound that has caught the ears of such revered Summer circuit stalwarts as Umphrey's McGee, Galactic, moe., Robert Randolph, and even The B52s who have all tapped Big Something as direct support. Recently the band has released their 4th full-length studio album, Tumbleweed, which was recorded once again with the help of grammy nominated producer and Carolina Music Awards Lifetime Achievement recipient - John Custer (Corrosion of Conformity). He has produced all of their albums including 2014's Truth Serum, which was named Album of the Year by The Homegrown Music Network, making Big Something the only band ever to win this award 3 times with 3 different releases (2010, 2013, and 2014). BIG Something has been featured in Relix Magazine, Guitar World, Glide Magazine, JamBase, ArtistDirect, and more. Website: www.bigsomething.com Facebook: www.facebook.com/thebigsomething Instagram: @bigsomethingofficial Twitter: @bigsomething Youtube: http://youtube.com/thebigsomething Bandcamp: http://bigsomething.bandcamp.com/ Spotify: http://spoti.fi/1sGotIg

Pumpkin Patch Presents: Acid Raindance, Soularplexus, Wesley C

Wednesday, February 14, 2018

8:00PM

Funk 'n Waffles Rochester

Rochester, NY

9
1435318996597638

Pumpkin Patch Presents: Acid Raindance, Soularplexus, Wesley C

Wednesday, February 14, 2018 8:00PM - Wednesday, February 14, 2018 11:00PM

$5 / Age 18 And Up Wesley Claire (8:00 - 8:45) The moment Wesley Claire steps on stage and sings her first note, you‚Äôll already know you‚Äôre experiencing something rare and beautiful. But then again, nothing about Wesley is conventional. Her eclectic style defies categorization; one moment she‚Äôs rocking out with a raw soulfulness reminiscent of Janis Joplin, the next she‚Äôs soothing you with a lullaby that is calming by even Norah Jones‚Äô standards. It‚Äôs this wildly dynamic range that brings together fans of all shapes and sizes to share a love of Wesley‚Äôs unbridled authenticity. She is, by every sense of the phrase, the real deal. Acid Raindance (9:00 - 10:00) We like to write and record, but above all, to improvise. Within the group, there is a focus on spontaneity and dexterity. We would like to be able to play each other's instruments with fluidity and to expand our sound with nontraditional instruments and technology. ARD wants to do big, big things, and you can be a part of it. Soular Plexus (10:15 - 11:30) We authentically summon while originally fusing the essence of ALL types of the blues, jazz, rock & roll, country, psychedelic, funk, classical, electronic, ambient, performance art, hip hop, neo soul, world music, soul, pop, and progressive styles. Old school meets new school. We love to play covers and have over 75 original songs. We write our own words and music and love to give lessons and have guests on stage. You've got a band that's gonna last, planet Earth. Tickets: https://www.ticketweb.com/event/pumpkin-patch-presents-funk-n-waffles-rochester-tickets/8023865?REFERRAL_ID=twfb

The Wailin' Jennys

Wednesday, February 14, 2018

8:00PM

State Theatre of Ithaca

Ithaca, NY

9
1451990951515798

The Wailin' Jennys

Wednesday, February 14, 2018 8:00PM

DSP Shows Presents: The Wailin' Jennys Wednesday, February 14th 8:00pm Show The State Theatre of Ithaca The Wailin Jennys are Nicky Mehta, Ruth Moody and Heather Masse three distinct voices that together make an achingly perfect vocal sound. Starting as a happy accident of solo singer/songwriters getting together for a one-time-only performance at a tiny guitar shop in Winnipeg, Manitoba, The Wailin‚Äô Jennys have grown over the years into one of today‚Äôs most beloved international folk acts. Founding members Moody and Mehta along with New York-based Masse continue to create some of the most exciting music on the folk-roots scene, stepping up their musical game with each critically lauded recording and thrilling audiences with their renowned live performances.

Papadosio & Aqueous at The Westcott Theater | February 15, 2018

Thursday, February 15, 2018

8:00PM

The Westcott Theater

Syracuse, NY

9
494972254219388

Papadosio & Aqueous at The Westcott Theater | February 15, 2018

Thursday, February 15, 2018 8:00PM - Friday, February 16, 2018 1:00AM

Tickets:: http://bit.ly/2k1FaQI General Admission: $17 Day of Show: $20 All Ages Doors - 8:00pm Show - 9:00pm PAPADOSIO: Papadosio returns east to bring good times like an old friend with stories that change nightly. Their blend of Progressive rock, Jazz and electronic music has paved the way for a show and sound like no other. With a new release on the horizon, they will be trying out their new ideas out as they hone in on the next batch of sweet musics. To add razzle to the dazzle, they are bringing in their audio reactive light show that reacts to each player's sounds to encourage a deeper connection with listeners. Expect lengthy improvisations mixed with hard hitting anthems and smooth psychedelic goo as Papadosio makes their return to the homeland. These guys are not short of experience having recently headlined festivals and venues such as Red Rocks Amphitheater, Electric Forest, Wanee, Oregon Eclipse, and Peach Festival. Their latest album Pattern Integrities has caught the eyes and ears of renowned alternative radio stations and press such as Jam On on sirius XM, Relix Magazine, and Live for Live Music. AQUEOUS: Aqueous‚Äôs groove rock sound stems from Buffalo NY. They have built a name for themselves nationally, following years of touring and high profile sets at major festivals. The band is as strong in composing as they are at communicating and improvising during their shows. Their onstage persona is infectious and undeniable; their lifelong friendship stands as a testament to the tightness of the music. While the band is relatively young, they are polished - check them out as soon as you can, and discover firsthand what the buzz is all about. --- LINKS http://papadosio.com/ http://www.facebook.com/papadosio www.aqueousband.com

Party with the Hoppah and BIG Irish Rover at ButaPub!

Thursday, February 15, 2018

7:00PM

ButaPub

Rochester, NY

9
148866015831616

Party with the Hoppah and BIG Irish Rover at ButaPub!

Thursday, February 15, 2018 7:00PM - Thursday, February 15, 2018 8:30PM

Party with the Hoppah and BIG Irish Rover at ButaPub! Be the first to try two of CB Craft Brewers newest brews fresh off the tap, as well as a classic favorite! CB BIG Irish Rover - Irish Red Ale This is not your traditional Irish Red Ale, this big dog comes in at 6.5% ABV! The Big Irish Rover displays a beautiful bright red hue, while keeping a hint of sweet flavor. Precise hopping delivers a crisp clean finish. CB Island Hoppah Tropical IPA This hazy, hoppy, JUICE BURST comes in at 6.5% ABV and is bursting with tropical fruit aroma and flavor. However, absolutely no fruit was harmed in the brewing of this beer! Only copious amounts of exotic hops. Giving the Hoppah unique characteristics unlike no other! CB Oak Aged Wee Heavy (2017) This traditional Scottish-Style Ale is all you need to keep warm through a NY winter. We use the finest Barley Malt to capture the earthy flavor associated with imported Scotch ales and single malt scotches. We then aged the beer for 2 weeks on oak chips and leave the beer unfiltered for an even smoother finish. Plus we'll be giving away awesome prizes! See you there!

Thur Feb 15th: After Funk w/ Funktional Flow

Thursday, February 15, 2018

9:00PM

Flour City Station

Rochester, NY

9
934398096712648

Thur Feb 15th: After Funk w/ Funktional Flow

Thursday, February 15, 2018 9:00PM - Friday, February 16, 2018 1:30AM

Flour City Station and herby1presents, an evening with After Funk and special guest Funktional Flow After Funk is a fun filled, soul driven, funk-rock explosion. Hailed as ‚ÄúThe grooviest band north of the border‚Äù (Live for Live Music), the Toronto based funk family have been blazing a trail through the North American music scene leaving only happy hearts and dancing feet in their wake. The combination of Yanick Allwood (keyboards & vocals), Jaime Rosenberg (drums), Justin Bontje (bass) and Phil Tessis (guitar) results in an infectiously fun show, as well as virtuosity and beauty that will challenge your musical mind. After Funk‚Äôs sound and hard work has not gone unnoticed; being selected as the Electric Forest‚Äôs Instrumental Forester in 2014 earned them two sets at the festival and they have served as support for Walk Off The Earth, Lettuce, Snarky Puppy, Dumpstaphunk, TAUK and more. The band has released 2 albums to help you prepare for the experience: ‚ÄòTil The Sun Comes Up features Canadian hip hop legend Choclair and earned over $10,000 in crowdfunding presales and their self-titled debut EP was mixed and mastered by Alan Evans of Soulive. Both albums promise to have you rocking out and singing along to catchy melodies and funky grooves. But if you truly want to find out what comes after the funk, you‚Äôll just have to come experience it for yourself. http://www.afterfunk.ca Hailing from Buffalo, NY, Funktional Flow is a multi-genre quintet heavily rooted in rock and reggae, with a funk foundation. Over the past six years, the band has released three albums and played hundreds of shows throughout the Northeast and beyond. With the release of the newest album "Time Will Tell‚Äù on March 5th 2016, Flow is poised to take it to the next level and branch out nationally. Flow is heavily influenced by Sublime, Umphreys McGee, Moe, and Blind Melon but maintains a fresh, high energy sound that results in a diverse catalog of music. Since the bands establishment in 2010, Funktional Flow has played notable music festivals such as Catskill Chill, The Great Blue Heron, A Bears Picnic, Buffalove Music Festival and Night Lights Music Festival. They also host their own festival, ‚ÄúFlow Fest‚Äù, at Woodlawn Beach located on the shores of Lake Erie, just outside of Buffalo, NY. Funktional Flow has shared the stage with many notable acts including; Warren Haynes, Railroad Earth, Rusted Root, New Riders of the Purple Sage and members of Little Feat. The Flow has succeeded in making a name for themselves throughout the North East and beyond; continuously earning recognition from musical publications. Recently the band was voted ‚ÄúBest Original Alternative Band‚Äù in Western New York. Also featured in Relix magazine‚Äôs ‚ÄúOn the Rise‚Äù section and was a previous winner of the coveted Artvoice ‚ÄúBest of Buffalo‚Äù award. Dubbed a multi-genre monster, Funktional Flow is best experienced in its natural state, a live performance. http://www.FunktionalFlow.com Thursday February 15th, 2018 Flour City Station 170 East Ave. Rochester, NY 21+ to enter $10 at the door 9:00pm doors 10:00pm Funktional Flow 11:30pm After Funk

FOLK City at Photo City: A Benefit for REACH

Friday, February 16, 2018

5:30PM

Photo City Improv: Comedy & Music Venue

Rochester, NY

9
193392001238984

FOLK City at Photo City: A Benefit for REACH

Friday, February 16, 2018 5:30PM - Sunday, February 18, 2018 11:00PM

We are so very pleased to be teaming up with REACH for 3 days of FOLKIN' good music... REACH: Rochester Engaging in Action for the Chronically Homeless Their Story: REACH Advocacy was born in 2015 when a group of citizens said "NO" to leaving the chronically homeless out in the cold. For the past several winters REACH has created and staffed temporary residential care facilities for those homeless persons who were unable to find shelter anywhere else. Following these experiences, they are seeking ways to advocate for the homeless to ensure that they are treated with dignity and respect. They remain convinced that NO person should be without a safe home and preferably offered affordable permanent housing. Their Dream: REACH Advocacy dreams of finding a property near public transportation that will serve as a temporary residential care facility in the coming winter and then be converted into permanent housing for homeless men and women. They have an amazing crew of volunteers who have cleaned and restored two properties in the past two winters. They believe that this longer vision will enable them to move into a more permanent solution for many of our homeless neighbors. Their Accomplishments: ‚Ä¢ Hundreds of volunteers supported with cleaning, feeding, driving and visiting. ‚Ä¢ Housing over 150 guests during the past two winters. ‚Ä¢ 40% placed in permanent housing. LET'S HELP THEM KEEP IT UP! FOLK CITY Schedule: Friday, February 16th 6-6:45pm Jungle Steve 6:45-745pm The Flood (duo) 7:45-8:30pm Tyler Westcott 8:30-9:15pm Twenty Thousand Strongmen 9:15-10pm Anson Stiles 10-11pm Folkfaces 11-11:45pm Collin Jones 11:45-? Floodwood Saturday, February 17th 6-6:45pm Tim Braley 6:45-7:45pm Ruckus Juice Jug Stompers 7:45-8:30pm Jon Itkin & Rita Proctor (of The Crooked North) 8:30-9:15pm Jungle Steve & the Gypsophelias 9:15-10:15pm Mike Brown 10:15-11pm PA Line 11:15pm-11:45pm Banjo Juice Jazz Band w/ The Meraki Dancers Midnight-? Electric Tie Dye Sunday, February 18th 4-4:45pm Damdog (solo) 4:45-5:45pm Mighty High & Dry (trio) 5:45-6:30pm Nate Coffey 6:30-7:15pm String Theory 7:15-8pm Seth Faergolzia (homecoming) 8-8:45pm Milkweed 8:45-9:30pm Aaron Lipp 9:30-? The Neighbors (w/ 2 members of Driftwood) LIVE PAINTING by Sadie May ALL 3 DAYS! WE ARE seeking SPONSORSHIP for this event!! If you own a local business or know someone who does and you're interested in being part of this event, please contact Gabriella Gauger at heydudeafterhours@gmail.com for more information. Thank you to our SPONSORS! eARTh House Sadie May's Art and Design Record Archive Ticketing Information: 1-Day Passes for $15 presale & $20 at the door 2-Day Passes presale for $25 3-Day Passes presale for $40 and a free drink! Get your tickets here -> https://cnytix.com/events/folk-city-at-photo-city Visit us @ www.heydudeafterhours.com Visit REACH at http://reachrochester.wixsite.com/reach

Free Music Happy Hour with The Immortal Jellyfish

Friday, February 16, 2018

6:00PM

None Specified

None Specified, None Specified

9
1993927664210890

Free Music Happy Hour with The Immortal Jellyfish

Friday, February 16, 2018 6:00PM - Friday, February 16, 2018 8:00PM

Free Music Happy Hour with Immortal Jellyfish at The Dock on Friday, February 16th from 6PM - 8PM Immortal Jellyfish A seasoned professional musical group that has quickly joined the A-list of Fingerlakes area bands over the past five years. Vocalist Kat Patton leads the band which includes the legendary Michael Vitucci on guitar. We cover the best of the American popular music song book...Billy Joel to Norah Jones, Clapton to Mary Chapin Carpenter. All musical genres show up in the mix...Motown, Blues, Swing, Rock and Country...and are presented in an authentic fashion in a way that only Immortal Jellyfish can.

Friday - Rub a Dub Social Mixer: The Medicinals, Bardic Vengeance, Fakaui & Joe Kaplan (PB)

Friday, February 16, 2018

8:00PM

Flour City Station

Rochester, NY

9
2052196555053085

Friday - Rub a Dub Social Mixer: The Medicinals, Bardic Vengeance, Fakaui & Joe Kaplan (PB)

Friday, February 16, 2018 8:00PM - Saturday, February 17, 2018 2:00AM

Doors: 8:30 PM Joe Kaplan (of Personal Blend): 9:00 PM to 9:45 PM Bardic Vengeance: 10:00 PM to 11:00 PM The Medicinals: 11:30 PM to 12:30 AM Fakaui: 1:00 AM to 2:00 AM 21 & Over The Rub a Dub Social Mixer is a Roots-Funky-Dub-Rock show for all of the ROC scene's live music fans to enjoy. A true concert that mixes it up where everyone can come together and kick it for the pure celebration of original dance music to replenish life, so make this your Valentine‚Äôs date to remember. The line up is completely stacked and we are very excited to be mixing up the genres for a complete balanced diet of dance music beyond compare as this show will be bringing you all the vibes of: Joe Kaplan as he starts the night off right with his amazing acoustic variations of Personal Blend favorites with his percussionist Jamie Greene. Then Bardic Vengeance, which is that crispy fresh booty shaking funk, will take the stage in full force. Then the Medicinals, who are that roots and dub reggae sound with those classic flavors on top of original roots rock rhythms, will round out the headliner spot proper. Lastly Fakaui, who bring that late night party rock hype, will send this show over the top into after-party mode. (Also they will be bringing their CD release back to Rochester for round 2 since the weather played a factor on their initial date).

Lost Wax Collective & B33T JU1C3 Live at The Range!

Friday, February 16, 2018

9:00PM

The Range

Ithaca, NY

9
187143755203682

Lost Wax Collective & B33T JU1C3 Live at The Range!

Friday, February 16, 2018 9:00PM - Saturday, February 17, 2018 12:30AM

Lost Wax Collective is a fresh 9 piece experimental soul group out of Rochester, NY... "To describe Lost Wax only in terms like jazz, soul, or Afro-beat would box the band into something it clearly can't fit in. This new nine-piece, polyrhythmic, future-soul collective of talented musicians takes advantage of each member's experienced individualism without ever compromising the larger sound." -Rochester CITY Newspaper Opening the night is Ithaca's very own B33T JU1C3 featuring Erik Johnson and The Babies! Afro-funk loops for the well being of your inner workings. THERE IS NO COVER. YOU JUST HAVE TO HAVE MADE THE SOLAR RETURN AT LEAST 21 TIMES, NOT INCLUDING TIME SPENT IN WOMB / PAST LIVES.

Luv Drunk WITH LASERS AND BLINKIN!!

Friday, February 16, 2018

8:00PM

Bug Jar

Rochester, NY

9
392276824552993

Luv Drunk WITH LASERS AND BLINKIN!!

Friday, February 16, 2018 8:00PM

It's Days after Valentines what better to do than have a good time with the one you love ‚ù§Ô∏è. Come on out and enjoy your local and not so local DJS melting your brains from 8-close. This will be a mixed genre night everything from psytrance, heavy breakbeats, dark techno, house to filthy grimy dubstep to keep everyone happy so get here early!! Stay tuned as updates will come daily ü§ò 8-9 SpunDaze-House/BassHouse He was born out of house partys and a strange cocktail someone left behind, suddenly his mind started to warp and the only thing that sounded right was the chest shaking bass coming from the dj. He then drew his mighty usb from points unknown and the rest is history. Drawing influences from all genres his heart thuds with a four on the floor beat. Are you ready to bring the HOUSE down? https://www.facebook.com/SpunDazeOfficial/ 9-10 Darkstar (Bass Music/Dubstep/Riddim) Since the earliest ages of the Universe and Time itself Darkstar, an entity created soley from bass waves has elevated crowds taking his listeners on an interstellar journey throughout the cosmic galacy and beyond using bass music. Incorperating different vibes and feelings within his performances have always been key to Darkstars sets as he likes a variety of sounds and music to please the crowds wide range of tastes. https://www.facebook.com/DarkstarDubstep/ 10-11 Syxgage-Break beatsü§ò Loves long walks to the mainstage. https://www.facebook.com/overryde/ 11-12 HUMANOID. bio... In 2002 this dj/turntablist started performing and throwing events in ulster county area. With a prolific background and keen ear for heavy bass Humanoid aka Dj Dvus has played many genres of electronic dance music. After holding a residency in Key West florida at Club Epoch he migrated back to the east coast.Starting off as a hard trance and house dj this performer is known for his driving style of hard hitting baselines and insane drops. This performer has played along side other techhouse legends like Adam X, Breakadawn, Dat Funky Drumma and trance phenom X-dream. Not to mention in 2005 opened up forJackel and Hyde and DJVenom at Sanktuary. In 2016 DJ DVUS fell I'll and was literally infected with Bass and reinvented himself through dubstep technology as a heavy hitter amongst his peers known as THE HUMANOID. This dj put all his energy into his performances using insane drops, unique track selection and insane chopping skills. This dj will have you moving and banging your fu*kn head from start to finish!!! https://www.facebook.com/prototypecitizen/ https://soundcloud.com/phantomsindustries/the-humanoid-this-is-war 12-1 Blinkin (Rochester, NY) - Psytrance/Hard Trance [ BadWolf, Hard Nights, Whirly ] www.soundcloud.com/blinkin www.mixcloud.com/blinkin Bio: Fueled by an obsession for bass soaked beats and dark four to the floor rhythms, Blinkin is an artist behind the decks who‚Äôs sound is continually evolving. Integrating the best elements of all the harder styles of dance music, he is well known for his unique track selection. Though psytrance and hard trance are his main forte, there is no such thing as a typical Blinkin set. You never can predict what fresh and obscure sounds he will bring to the table. So get your dancin‚Äô shoes on ravers, and be prepared for some HARD BASS that will rattle your insides on the dance floor! 1-2 Darkstep- bio... It's all about the wubs and feels ‚ù§Ô∏è A lot of what this guy brings has feeling and people can relate to that when experiencing a set from this man. He started learning the ropes back in 2013 with DJ Flex and many others whenever possible on a Wednesday night playing tunes for his local whirly Wednesday friends and now family. Since then Darkstep has progressed with a consistent flow and brutal drops, always staying aggressive never letting up. Influenced heavily by 90's-2000 era music you will be sure to hear something you grew up with and some sort of crazy memory will come about fallowed by a smile üòä https://m.facebook.com/DARKSTEP7X/

DSP Shows Presents Murphy's Law with special guests Mill Bastards and Talk Hard at The Haunt on 2/16!! 8:00pm doors 9:00pm show Murphy's Law http://www.DeadCityMerch.com Founded in Astoria, Queens in 1983 Murphy's Law are huge part of the New York and American hardcore legacy. Their albums, such as the self entitled, "Murphy's Law" and the 1989 follow up "Back With A Bong" helped creating the sound of New York Hardcore back then, as well as what it stands for today. Friday, February 16, 2018 8:00PM - Friday, February 16, 2018 11:00PM

RnB Classics Live and The Historic German House is proud to present: What's Going On! An anthology of the greatest hits from Marvin Gaye including memorable duets with Kim Weston, Mary Wells & Tammi Terrell. One of the most enduring American musical artists of the 20th century, his music is presented with a thirteen piece orchestra and four outstanding vocalists. It's a note for note experience of some of the greatest music ever recorded!

Hardcore for the Homeless

Saturday, February 17, 2018

8:00PM

Bug Jar

Rochester, NY

9
136858593648063

Hardcore for the Homeless

Saturday, February 17, 2018 8:00PM

Hardcore for the homeless is a yearly hardcore show in Rochester NY. After the holidays the donations tend to slow down, and February is one of the coldest months of the year. So we put on a hardcore show in hopes of raising money/donations, to help those in need. All money/donations go to a local homeless shelter. REACH 102 North Union Street Rochester NY, 14607 Donations: Winter jackets, bottled water, new underwear and socks, gift cards from chain stores for shoes, personal grooming products such as deodorant, toothbrushes, toothpaste, combs, brushes, tissues, toilet paper, feminine hygiene, travel size soap and shampoo, baby wipes, sleeping bags and reading glasses. Doors at 8pm $5 over $7 under Bands: The Weight We Carry (Rochester) https://twwc.bandcamp.com/ Borrowed Time (Rochester) https://borrowedtimehc.bandcamp.com/releases AASB (Utica) https://aasbcrew.bandcamp.com/releases Wreckage (Buffalo) https://wreckagebuffalo.bandcamp.com Bone Mask (Rochester) https://bonemask.bandcamp.com/album/the-mill Edge Control (Syracuse straight edge) https://edgecontrol.bandcamp.com/releases

IU Fundraiser: Attic Abasement, Justin Roeland & Nightswimmers, Chef Fol, Chris Corsano

Saturday, February 17, 2018

8:00PM

The Haunt

Ithaca, NY

9
721561464700023

IU Fundraiser: Attic Abasement, Justin Roeland & Nightswimmers, Chef Fol, Chris Corsano

Saturday, February 17, 2018 8:00PM

Join us in supporting local music for Ithaca Underground‚Äôs annual February Fundraiser! Attic Abasement - Rochester, NY https://atticabasement.bandcamp.com/ Slow-rolling bummer rock with plucky guitars and moments for pause. Mike Rheinheimer has been writing cleverly melancholic music under the moniker Attic Abasement for nearly a decade. Transforming over time from solo lofi tapes into a full piece band, Attic Abasement retains the intimacy and honesty in Rheinheimer‚Äôs voice and words; existential anxieties played out with a sense of humor. Justin Roeland and Nightswimmers - Ithaca, NY https://roeland.bandcamp.com/ Bright, shimmery sixties-inspired pop that reminds you of a summer haze Chef Fol - Ithaca, NY https://www.facebook.com/cheffol/ Squashed ego driven hip hop, future bass, and trap music drowned in a sea of fuzz and warmth. Chris Corsano - Ithaca, NY http://www.cor-sano.com/ Chris Corsano is a drummer who has been at the vanguards of free improvisation, avant-rock, and noise musics since the late 1990's. Constantly seeking to expand his sound way beyond conventional notions of what drums can and can't do, Corsano attacks his kit with everything from cello strings stretched across his snare drum to contact microphones on hi-hats to a slew of extended techniques of his own creation. 7 PM - $10 - ALL AGES - SAFE SPACE - NO PUNK TIME

Root Shock at The One Stop

Saturday, February 17, 2018 10:00PM - Sunday, February 18, 2018 2:00AM

Genre: Reggae/Dub/Soul Cover: Donations @ Door Show: 10PM Ages: 21+ Root Shock Root Shock formed in 2012 with regional veteran musicians whose love of reggae music flows deep. Their unique blend of reggae and heavy drum & bass combined with American roots and soul, and a focus on conscious lyrics result in positive dance music will make you want to move! The band has been surprising and delighting crowds across the New York region and beyond, bringing their unique high-energy style spearheaded by the stunning soulful vocals and stage presence of Jessica Brown to a wide range of settings. The band‚Äôs dedication to spreading music with a positive message has paid off in entertaining, elevating, and energizing music lovers of all walks of life! On the heels of their 2016 debut album, Root Shock is stepping up their game, hitting the road and bringing their renowned live show to clubs, festivals and concert halls far and wide. The band is concentrating on spreading their uplifting message and vibes to the masses. Root Shock‚Äôs genre-bending sound has proven to fit many musical settings yet always stand out! Root Shock is: Jessica Brown - Vocals & Melodica Bill Eppel ‚Äì Bass Guitar Cix Nyne ‚Äì Drums & Vocals Phil Grajko ‚Äì Guitar & Vocals Nick Kaczmar ‚Äì Keyboards Jason ‚ÄúJocko‚Äù Randall ‚Äì Percussion, Electronics & Vocals Dan Valvassori ‚Äì Guitar web: http://www.rootshockmusic.com/ vid: https://youtu.be/6VxS8VRzrIs

The Toronto-based band has released eight acclaimed studio albums, the most recent debuting at #9 on the U.S. national Billboard Heatseekers charts. Their original songs such as ‚ÄúOne Last Drink‚Äù, ‚ÄúDown With The Ship‚Äù and ‚ÄúGasoline‚Äù have become folk rock anthems, appearing in films such as ‚ÄúGoon‚Äù, ‚Äú10mph‚Äù and ‚ÄúAddicted to Plastic‚Äù, and reaching as high as #25 on U.S. radio. https://www.enterthehaggis.com/home Tickets: http://www.ticketweb.com/event/enter-the-haggis-wsg-tbd-funk-n-waffles-rochester-tickets/7969855?REFERRAL_ID=twfb Tickets also on sale at: Funk 'n Waffles Rochester

The 3rd Tuesday of the month will be here before you know it, which means Kubick's Rubes will once again be bringing our unique blend of Bluegrass, Western Swing, and other Roots Music back to Johnny's Pub & Grill. Music will begin at 7pm. Sandwiched between two Rubes sets will be a showcase set by the inimitable Tyler Westcott. Tyler has been performing his rowdy mix of Folk, Jazz, Blues, Punk, Ragtime, & Americana across WNY and beyond, garnering well-deserved acclaim both as a solo act and as a member of Folkfaces, The Observers, Black Rock Zydeco, and the Banjo Juice Jazz Band. We‚Äôre psyched to have him come and pick with us. And if the stars align, we'll also be treated to some mando-mania courtesy of exalted guest Rube John Denniston. So come on out for a great evening of music, food, and libations! No cover!

Howl Story Slam Saranac Lake

Friday, February 23, 2018

7:00PM

Waterhole

Saranac Lake, NY

9
394588170986277

Howl Story Slam Saranac Lake

Friday, February 23, 2018 7:00PM - Friday, February 23, 2018 9:00PM

Howl Story Slam True stories, told locally presented by Adirondack Center for Writing and North Country Public Radio February 23 at 7pm at Waterhole Suggested donation: $5 How does it work? Storytellers (you, your friends and anyone else with a story to tell) put their names in a hat. Names are picked, and one by one, storytellers take the stage and tell us their best story in five minutes on the theme "Leap of faith/Going for it". Two local judges will score every story to select The Howl Story Slam winners of the night. Winners will be invited to compete at the Howl Grand Story Slam in December. What else? All stories have to be true and come from personal experience. No notes. Do you need to be a professional storyteller? Heck no! Just tell it from the heart! The The Howl Story SLAM is brought to you by North Country Public Radio and the Adirondack Center for Writing, a partnership brought about by a love and support of all stories and storytellers in the Adirondack North Country. Visit our website for tips on telling your story and for more info: https://adirondackcenterforwriting.org/what-we-do/howl/

Organically Good Trio with Conscious Roots at Nectar's

Friday, February 23, 2018

9:00PM

Nectar's

Burlington, VT

9
517420008631260

Organically Good Trio with Conscious Roots at Nectar's

Friday, February 23, 2018 9:00PM - Saturday, February 24, 2018 12:00AM

Sponsored by Citizen Cider and Zero Gravity Craft Brewery 9pm doors 21+ $7 ~~~~~~~~~~~~ Organically Good Trio Featuring members of Slightly Stoopid, John Brown's Body and Dub Apocalypse. Organically Good Trio is a Hammond organ driven roots instrumental group out of Boston. Founded by Slightly Stoopid keyboard player Paul Wolstencroft, the band has a sound reminiscent of the great organ trio albums of the late 60's Mixed with a reggae organ trio style. Hailing from Boston, the band has created a new sound among organ trio music. A mixture of reggae, soul, and boogaloo the band is forging a new path forward both in live shows, and in the recording studio. The band has just released its new CD Monster Sound which debuted at #8 on the iTunes reggae charts. Described as a mix between the sounds of Jackie Mittoo, Ernest Ranglin and Burning Spear, the album is quickly gaining a lot of attention and can be found here http://smarturl.it/OGT_MonsterSound Band members Paul Wolstencroft (Slightly Stoopid) Hammond Organ Van Martin (Dub Apocalypse) Guitar Tommy Benedetti (John Brown's Body) Drums Conscious Roots As Northern Vermonts roots reggae band, Conscious Roots has come together to create a mix of original music blending afro-beat rhythms, ska, jazz,and rock. Celebrating our fifth year together, our style has been compared to Rage Against the Machine meets the fathers of reggae. The philosophy held is that this is not a place but a state of mind that continues throughout daily life. With a progressive message of hope and unity we have become Vermonts biggest underground reggae band, where we hold our community of people to the highest regards. Picking up Grammy nominated drummer Jason Corbiere, Room Full of Blues, this band of Vermonters has taken the next step towards the ultimate goal of bringing people together, no matter what differences we have. Everybody keep truckin‚Äô and we‚Äôll see ya at the next show.

Pete Frank Band at Flour City Station

Friday, February 23, 2018

9:00PM

Flour City Station

Rochester, NY

9
139025320093960

Pete Frank Band at Flour City Station

Friday, February 23, 2018 9:00PM - Saturday, February 24, 2018 12:00AM

The Pete Frank Band was started by the lead singer of ZBTB, the country's premier Zac Brown Tribute Band out of Rochester NY. Pete has teamed up with some of the top performers in NY State to put together something that allows for him to play more then just the songs of the Zac Brown Band. The Pete Frank band is an 8 piece band of multi-instrumentalists that are all strong singers. 6 of the guys are typically fronting their own projects. We have come together to make a super group with soaring harmony lines and technical instrumental notes for the ultimate party experience. We draw our audience in with exceptional singing and note for note playing of country favorites from Zac Brown Band, Chris Stapleton, Luke Bryan, Eric Church, and other current popular artists, tied in with feel good music crossing generations to deliver a unique stage show that is not something that can be found anywhere else. The Band is Comprised of: Pete Frank - Lead vocal, guitar, keys Mike Kedley - Fiddle, Mandolin, banjo, guitar, vocals Dave Belec - Keys, guitar, saxophone, vocals Jon Belec - Pedal Steel, guitar, trombone, vocals Matt Sauer - Lead Guitar/Guitar, Vocals Bryan Price - Guitar, Trombone, vocals Shawn Rotolo - Bass Guitar, vocals Christos Dembeyiotis - Drums/Percussion Combined we have more then 220 years of stage performance experience under our belts and can give an unparalleled show of nonstop entertainment.

Aaron Rizzo, Lazy Bones, Butter

Saturday, February 24, 2018

8:00PM

The Dock

Ithaca, NY

9
149849768977815

Aaron Rizzo, Lazy Bones, Butter

Saturday, February 24, 2018 8:00PM

DSP Shows Presents Aaron Rizzo, Lazy Bones, and Butter at The Dock on 2/24!! 7:00pm Doors 8:00pm Show Aaron Rizzo https://aaronrizzomusic.bandcamp.com/ Aaron Rizzo is an American singer-songwriter, multi-instrumentalist, producer and recording engineer born and raised in Rochester, NY. Self recorded, mixed and produced, Aaron Rizzo's debut album "Blck Tee Shrt" hit stores on January 15th, 2017. Aaron Rizzo studies the art of music recording under the direction of Alex Perialas and Michael Caporizzo. Influences range from John Mayer to BJ The Chicago Kid, as he pays respects to genres such as blues, rock, R&B, pop and hip-hop. ‚Äã Aaron Rizzo began his musical career playing in various rock, blues and jazz bands, later graduating into a pursuit of a solo career. Rizzo began playing guitar at the age of nine, later to hunt mastery in other instruments including drums, bass, piano and voice. Aaron Rizzo draws much of his influence not from guitar players, but drummers. Figures like Steve Jordan, Mike Miley and Carter Beauford all have made their way into Rizzo's musical works. ‚Äã "Blck Tee Shrt" is available on iTunes, Spotify, Apple Music, Tidal, Amazon Music and aaronrizzomusic.com. Lazy Bones https://www.facebook.com/Lazy-Bones-278177542639203/ Lazy Bones is an alternative band consisting of two multi-intstrumentalists, Sam Stein and Brendan Olivieri, and a drummer, Caleb Matheson. All recording, mixing, and mastering is done by the trio, who can be reached at any hour of the night by knocking on the door at IC's studio. Butter https://www.facebook.com/butterfunkithaca/ Formed in March 2016 by guitarist Nicky Young and Jonah Bobo, Butter has made it‚Äôs mission to bring funky music to as many people as they could. From the first rehearsal, the whole band knew that this group could be something special. Since then, Butter has played several events on and off the Ithaca College campus, growing as a unit and delivering an increasingly exciting show for their audiences.

Big Youth: Bob Marley Celebration Show

Saturday, February 24, 2018

8:00PM

The Haunt

Ithaca, NY

9
165870004050104

Big Youth: Bob Marley Celebration Show

Saturday, February 24, 2018 8:00PM

DSP Shows Presents Big Youth: Bob Marley Celebration Show at The Haunt! 7pm Doors 8pm Show Roots Reggae selections by special guest Jay Spaker of JBB Big Youth Big Youth was part of the first wave of Jamaican DJ‚Äôs inspired by U-Roy. After a series of chart singles in Jamaica, he released dozens of albums, toured internationally and helped set the standard for a whole generation of DJ‚Äôs to follow. Throughout his career, Big Youth emphasized the natural Rastafarian lifestyle and adopted the political message of Bob Marley and the Wailers and other Jamaican artists of his generation. Official after-party at Casita Del Polaris! Get a discount on the cover with your Big Youth ticket stub!

The Buddhahood w/ The Travis Prinzi Band! 7:30pm doors 8:30pm show $5 general admission The Buddhahood / Worldternative www.reverbnation.com/buddhahood Blurring the line between stage and dance floor, The Buddhahood abides with the vibes and after losing their beloved band leader, Tony Cavagnaro, to a car crash in 2007, they continue on with the sound he created while mixing their own new, fresh Buddha batter onto the scene, whipping crowds of enthusiastic fans into a frenzy and transcending audiences with their explosive and soulful shows. This is an incarnation whose musical energy comes from power and spirit, and with songs about perspective, picking oneself up and having crazy amounts of fun. Come Together For The Kitties feat. The Dirty Smugglers

Saturday, February 24, 2018

8:00PM

Flour City Station

Rochester, NY

9
183208765592170

Come Together For The Kitties feat. The Dirty Smugglers

Saturday, February 24, 2018 8:00PM - Sunday, February 25, 2018 2:00AM

Schedule of events: Doors. 8pm 9-9:45 Mike Dahl & Mike Shapiro (acoustic set of Jerry Garcia ballads) 10-11:45 The Dirty Smugglers ( featuring members of Dirty Blanket and The Honey Smugglers playing a set of The Beatles) 12- 1:30 PA line (Buffalo NY) This is a benefit concert for the Hearthside Cats no kill animal shelter. The shelter needs our help. They currently are located in a facility that is run down and we want to raise money to try to get them into a new healthier place. We also want to help them out with much needed supplies for the daily operation of the facility. Www.hearthsidecats.org There will be a 5 dollar cover charge at the door. Part of the proceeds from the door will go directly to the shelter. We will also be doing raffles which will also help raise money for the shelter. If you are an artist or have something you would like to donate to the raffle please contact anna sunshine. She will be handling all the raffles. Raffle tickets will be 1 dollar a piece or an arms length for 10 dollars. Each item will have a basket that you can enter as many times as you want. Drawings will be held at approx 12:30 am and you will need to be present to win. So plan on hanging out for the night. List of raffle items already received include: Jerry Garcia print donated by Mike dahl 2 tickets to The Blue Marble Music Festival 2018 at Eddy Ridge Farms 2 tickets to an upcoming Flour City Station event 2 VIP tickets to The Fiddlers Picnic 2018 at Eddy Ridge Farms Wire wrap piece by Jon guzzardi 2 adventure land pins, stones with jar and 2 Crystal point necklaces donated by ravens corner 3 headed sculpture and cooky poster (Pictures below) 1 black and white mandala tapestry 1 CB 700 educational percussion xylophone "Gardeners dream" basket to quench that urge to grow! Basket comes with seeds,terra cotta pot, succulent and aloe plant. (And much more) Plus many more items which we will add so keep checking back to see what's new. And of course we will have donation stations for either money or supplies. Here is a list of supplies that are needed. Purina indoor cat chow ‚Ä¢ Purina kitten chow ‚Ä¢ Any clumping litter ‚Ä¢ Towels ‚Ä¢ Blankets ‚Ä¢ Sheets ‚Ä¢ Toys ‚Ä¢ Paper towels and plates ‚Ä¢ Friskies pate wet food ‚Ä¢ KMR ‚Ä¢ Safe cleaning supplies ‚Ä¢ Crates ‚Ä¢ Carriers ‚Ä¢laundry soap Every little bit helps. Thanks everyone. Please help us spread the word. Invite your friends and we will see you in Feb!!!

Into the Mystic - Van Morrison Tribute - Waterhole Music Lounge

Saturday, February 24, 2018

9:00PM

Saranac Lake, NY

9

Into the Mystic - Van Morrison Tribute - Waterhole Music Lounge

Saturday, February 24, 2018 9:00PM - Sunday, February 25, 2018 1:00AM

Into the Mystic - Van Morrison Tribute with Justin Panigutti Band Waterhole Upstairs Music Lounge Feb. 24, 2018 - 8pm Doors 9pm Show $10.00 Tickets 21+ www.saranaclakewaterhole.com 48 Main St. Saranac Lake, NY 12983 Into the Mystic - Van Morrison Tribute - Burlington, VT Spanning over 5 decades, the musical catalogue and work of Van Morrison has been a steady stream of inspiration for musicians and countless others who choose to include them in the soundtracks of our their lives. ‚ÄúWith one of the most revered catalogues in music history and his unparalleled talents as composer, singer and performer Morrison‚Äôs past achievements loom large. But, as throughout his extraordinary career, how that past informs his future achievements and still stirs excitement and keen anticipation‚Äù Drawing from his complete collection of works, ‚ÄúInto the Mystic‚Äù, seeks to recreate the spirit and energy of Morrison‚Äôs Music and pay respects to a man who himself is a hard act to catch and most humbly follow in 2017. Bridging this gap, 8 piece- Into the Mystic, Led by vocalist Justin Panigutti (formerly of Bearquarium), is comprised of some of the area‚Äôs finest musicians and portrayers, coming together to produce an evening of Van Morrison‚Äôs finest work and promising to be a musical experience not to disappoint. Justin Panigutti Band - Burlington, VT https://www.justinpaniguttimusic.com

Mystic Bowie's Talking Dreads Single Release Party!

Saturday, February 24, 2018

9:00PM

Nectar's

Burlington, VT

9
1377097325749819

Mystic Bowie's Talking Dreads Single Release Party!

Saturday, February 24, 2018 9:00PM - Sunday, February 25, 2018 12:00AM

Sponsored by Zero Gravity Craft Brewery and Citizen Cider 9pm doors 21+ $7 ~~~~~~~~~ Mystic Bowie's Talking Dreads: Reggaefied Talking Heads ‚ÄãA ‚ÄãSingle Release Party ‚Äãwith Adventure Dog Mystic Bowie's Talking Dreads You may think ‚Äúthis ain‚Äôt no party, this ain‚Äôt no disco, this ain‚Äôt no foolin‚Äô around‚Äù music, and you‚Äôre right: this is serious...as in seriously good! A non-stop, fun- loving musical journey that‚Äôs as good for the head as it is for the soul. So get ready to get up, get set and get down as Talking Dreads take you joyriding in their tour-de-force debut! Talking Dreads began as a project born from the audacious notion that hardcore Heads-lovers wouldn‚Äôt mind a tinkering or two with their favorite Talking Heads tunes, and there is a lot of great music here that will make you stop, listen and smile a little bit more as you‚Äôre grooving along to the joyous rhythms and jubilant spirit of the island vibe. Talking Dreads is the brainchild of Head Dread, Mystic Bowie, a Jamaican artist whose long and close relationship with Chris Franz and Tina Weymouth, founding members of Talking Heads and Tom Tom Club, began when he joined the latter group as a singer in 1996. He then recorded and performed with Tom Tom Club for nearly twenty years and continues to bear fruit from their unending collaborations. Adventure Dog Rock 'n' Roll with a ~Funky~ soul. Five dawgs bringing you soothing melodies, tight vocals, and powerful hornlines. We've been shaking up the streets of Burlington for almost six months now.. Come boogie with us!

The Mother Funkin' Planets, Charles Walker Band at Funk 'n Waffles

Saturday, February 24, 2018

9:30PM

Funk 'n Waffles Rochester

Rochester, NY

9
160938454535448

The Mother Funkin' Planets, Charles Walker Band at Funk 'n Waffles

Saturday, February 24, 2018 9:30PM - Sunday, February 25, 2018 1:30AM

$5 Pre-Sale | $7 Door / Age 18 And Up Charles Walker Band (9:30 - 10:45) Grounded in soul, the Charles Walker Band has been compared to Prince, Bruno Mars, The Brand New Heavys, and James Brown. The Milwaukee based band has refined their sound into Neo-Funk, a fusion of funk infused rhythms with pop melodies. The three-piece band rehearses tirelessly in Charles‚Äô basement, amidst couches and low ceilings, Charles having to stoop the entire time. Surprisingly, at the band‚Äôs shows, there are no fans. There is only family. The question posed at the beginning of the first song is, Are we family or not? The band evokes positive energy to their family members, who say they always feel better than when they arrived. The Charles Walker Band is Deliciously Stanky. Dynamically Funky. Recklessly Hopeful. The Mother Funkin Planets (11:15 - 1:00) Fresh new Funk Groove Powerhouse from Rochester, NY! Tickets: https://www.ticketweb.com/event/the-mother-funkin-planets-charles-funk-n-waffles-rochester-tickets/8024325?REFERRAL_ID=twfb Tickets also on sale at: Aaron's Alley

Ethnic Heritage Ensemble: presented by Bop Arts

Sunday, February 25, 2018

7:30PM

Lovin' Cup

Rochester, NY

9
451142161950337

Ethnic Heritage Ensemble: presented by Bop Arts

Sunday, February 25, 2018 7:30PM

$ 20.00 / Age All Ages Additional Info: Kahil ElZabars Ethnic Heritage Ensemble has been one of the flagship ensembles of the AACM since the mid -1970s, when the band emerged from the Chicago creative music organization. Since 2000, when Kahil ElZabar first brought his trio into the Bop Shop, we have been treated to various editions of the band. That first time, the EHE featured reedman Ernest Khabeer Dawkins and trombonist Joseph Bowie. Over the years the personnel has morphed but the trio has always had interesting permutations including the addition of young, dynamic trumpeter Corey Wilkes. In the spring of 2016, he brought an unusual variation into the Lovin Cup with trombonist Craig Harris and baritone sax master Hamiet Blueitt. ElZabar has also appeared at the Bop Shop in duet and trio formats with violinist Billy Bang and saxophonist David Murray.So we eagerly await to hear what ElZabar has in store for us this time. Corey Wilkes is back in the lineup and his accomplished blend of the tradition, contemporary music and the future are always to the fore. The real surprise this time around is baritone saxophonist Alex Harding. Emerging in the mid-1990s, he played in the bands of Julius Hemphill, ex-Sun Ra trumpeter Ahmed Abdullah and the baritone sax quartet of Hamiet Blueitt. He also has released his own recordings on CIMP, recordings with Romanian pianist Lucian Ban (who played at the Bop Shop this past fall) in various configurations. Reviewers have commented not only on his bluesy, from-the-church sound but also on his ability to let his gorgeous tone hang clearly in the air like a puff of rich cream. It will be interesting to hear what he brings to the EHE.But with whoever is in the band at any given time, with the guidance of Kahil El Zabar, one is assured that the Ethnic Heritage Ensemble will be delivering on the AACMs dictum: Great Black Music: Ancient To The Future.Kahil ElZabar:www.allmusic.com/aritst/kahil-elzabarwww.chicagotribune.com/EHE:www.allmusic.com/artist/ Tickets: http://www.ticketweb.com/event/ethnic-heritage-ensemble-presented-by-lovin-cup-tickets/7944995?REFERRAL_ID=twfb

Bim Skala Bim w/s/g The Beaumonts, Some Ska Band

Monday, February 26, 2018

8:00PM

Funk 'n Waffles Rochester

Rochester, NY

9
938432326312074

Bim Skala Bim w/s/g The Beaumonts, Some Ska Band

Monday, February 26, 2018 8:00PM

$ 12.00 / Age 18 And Up The Boumonts (8:00 - 8:30) Some Ska Band (8:45 - 9:15) In October, 2011, in the basement of a local ad agency, five scrappy musicians formed a band with one simple dream: to pull off the biggest diamond heist the world had ever seen. They also discovered that they shared a love of ska, that greatest of all music genres. From the earliest works of the originators like Theo. Beckford, Desmond Deckker and The Skatalites, through the 2Tone era of The Specials, Madness and The English Beat, to 3rd wave and contemporary powerhouses like Rancid, The Toasters and The New Town Kings, Some Ska Band has it covered. Plus, they have a growing pile of originals that have hit written all over them. All told, the band spans 5 decades and two time zones, bringing a loose, laid-back, ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs-the-worst-that-can-happen?‚Äù party attitude to every show. Bim Skala Bim (9:30 - 11:00) Bim Skala Bim formed in Boston, MA as a Ska Rock band that was influenced by the bands in England‚Äôs 2 Tone movement as well as bands such as the Clash, UB40 and Bob Marley. Bim‚Äôs infectious ‚ÄúBoston Blue Beat‚Äù sound‚Äîa mix of upbeat 2 Tone Ska, Rock n Roll and a pinch of Calypso‚Äîwith a substantial Reggae undertone led them, together with The Toasters, to be the premier bands kickstarting the Third Wave of Ska in the 1980s. Other bands quickly followed their example resulting in a lively scene in Boston and much of the United States. Tickets: http://www.ticketweb.com/event/bim-skala-bim-wsg-the-funk-n-waffles-rochester-tickets/7956515?REFERRAL_ID=twfb Tickets also on sale at: Aaron's Alley

Skyfoot with Chasing Dorothy at Nectar's

Wednesday, February 28, 2018 9:00AM - Wednesday, February 28, 2018 11:59PM

Skyfoot heads up north for their debut at historic Nectar's! Skyfoot is a powerful jamband from Boston, MA that plays a variety of genres from funk, rock, reggae & bluegrass to sonic landscapes and fusion. Their live shows consist of mostly original songs with tight compositions and improvisational jamming which yield memorable peaks and valleys. Each unpredictable performance varies with each location and feature in-the-moment unpremeditated occurrences that are recorded and archived.

Nectar's

Burlington, VT

9
1502361769832949

MaLarky: A Tribute to The Cranberries at Nectar's

Thursday, March 1, 2018 9:30PM - Friday, March 2, 2018 12:30AM

9:30pm doors 18+ $5 ~~~~~~~~~~ Dolores O‚ÄôRiordan of the popular Irish rock band ‚ÄúThe Cranberries‚Äù passed away January 15, 2018 at the age of 46. Local vocalist Samara Lark seeks to pay tribute to O‚ÄôRiordan‚Äôs songcraft and lilting vocals March 1st at Nectar‚Äôs with her new project, ‚ÄúMaLarky.‚Äù MaLarky will cover a wide variety of Cranberries‚Äô hits as well as some lesser-known songs spanning 6 albums and 24 years of O‚ÄôRiordan‚Äôs songwriting career. From 1993‚Äôs ‚ÄúEveryone Else Is Doing It, So Why Can‚Äôt We?‚Äù to 2017‚Äôs ‚ÄúSomething Else,‚Äù Samara Lark‚Äôs MaLarky will bring all the ethereal angst from O‚ÄôRiordan‚Äôs songwriting back to the stage. Samara Lark (Wee Folkestra, Wave of the Future)- vox Jackie Buttolph (Leatherbound Books, Wee Folkestra) - supporting vox Lara Cwass - guitar Matt Harpster (Mob Barber, Apex) - guitar Jake Styles (Sad Turtle, Wave of the Future) - bass Cody Sargent - drums

Come hear the band 'cause we're coming to you. The tree grows bigger like all saplings do. Dynamo (10:30 - 12:30) Dynamo is Nashville-based, nationally touring band whose music fuses jazz, rock, and funk with elements of soul and R&B. The culmination is a sound that‚Äôs both spontaneous and composed‚Äîand an energy that‚Äôs undeniably infectious. Formed in late 2012, Dynamo consists of nine core musicians. When they‚Äôre not performing or recording in Nashville, the band is on the road, spreading their unique brand of feel-good music to audiences all over the world. Root Shock has been surprising and delighting crowds across the Central New York region, bringing their unique high-energy style spearheaded by the stunning vocals of Jessica Brown to a wide range of settings. The band‚Äôs dedication to spreading music with a positive message has paid off in entertaining, elevating, and energizing music lovers of all walks of life!

DSP Shows Presents Start Making Sense: Talking Heads Tribute at The Haunt on 3/2!! 7:00pm Show 8:000pm Doors Start Making Sense: Talking Heads Tribute http://www.startmakingsenseband.com/ If David Byrne is one of the geniuses of modern times, then Start Making Sense is a tribute to genius. The musicians in this 7-piece Talking Heads Tribute take pride in faithfully recreating the music of Talking Heads entire career. Together they bring much of the Heads unique live show to the stage, with front man Jon Braun as a spot-on David Byrne, giving you a "once in a lifetime" experience. Kat Wright, Swift Technique - FnW ROC

Saturday, March 3, 2018

9:00PM

Funk 'n Waffles Rochester

Rochester, NY

9
142962176379261

Kat Wright, Swift Technique - FnW ROC

Saturday, March 3, 2018 9:00PM - Sunday, March 4, 2018 12:00AM

Doors 8:00 PM $10 tickets Age 18+ Kat Wright (9:00 - 10:15) Kat Wright, whose voice is both sultry and dynamic, delicate yet powerful; gritty but highly emotive and nuanced, has been described as ‚Äúa young Bonnie Raitt meets Amy Winehouse‚Äù. Add to that voice enough stage presence to tame lions, and the combination of feline femininity proves immediately enchanting. There‚Äôs soul flowing in and out of her rock ‚Äòn‚Äô roll with a serpentine seduction. Some of soul music‚Äôs sweet, grand dames belt, shout, seethe, and succumb, while Wright sings gently like a heartache‚Äôs apology. It‚Äôs funky in spots and beautiful all over. And it hurts a little ‚Ä¶ like it should. Swift Technique (10:45 - ???) For Swift Technique, every show is the craziest basement party you‚Äôve ever been to. Representing Philadelphia in the funkiest way possible, Swift‚Äôs mission is to get you grooving, get you grinning, and fill you with the positive energy that world so sorely needs. Come out and see what thousands of satisfied funksters across the US have already experienced. With the hype around Swift Technique building at lightning speed, look for these gritty groove masters to take large leaps forward in the coming year! After forming in 2007, Swift Technique has relentlessly toured, performed and recorded throughout the US. The extremely positive and contagious chemistry shared by the band has always been translated in the live setting. With the 2013 release of, ‚Äúyou boys be aight‚Äù, Swift Technique established themselves as an up and coming force in the recording industry. Although the group draws from many influences ranging Funk & Soul to Hip-Hop & Rock, their genre is uniquely Philadelphia. Tickets: https://www.ticketweb.com/t3/sale/SaleEventDetail?eventId=8110775&pl=funknwaffles&dispatch=loadSelectionData

Palehound

Saturday, March 3, 2018

8:00PM

The Dock

Ithaca, NY

9
134200767288662

Palehound

Saturday, March 3, 2018 8:00PM

Ithaca Underground and DSP Shows Present Palehound with Boy Scouts, Tim Woulfe and clam lust at The Dock on 3/3!! *PLEASE NOTE NEW DOOR/SHOW TIMES* 6:00PM Doors 7:00PM Show Palehound The sophomore album from the Boston trio Palehound, A Place I'll Always Go, is a frank look at love and loss, cushioned by indelible hooks and gently propulsive, fuzzed-out rock. Ellen Kempner, Palehound's vocalist, guitarist, and songwriter explains, "A lot of it is about loss and learning how to let yourself evolve past the pain and the weird guilt that comes along with grief." Kempner's writing comes from upheavals she experienced in 2015 and 2016 that reframed her worldview. "I lost two people I was really close with," she recalls. "I lost my friend Lily. I lost my grandmother too, but you expect that at 22. When you lose a friend -- a young friend -- nothing can prepare you for that. A lot of the record is about going on with your life, while knowing that person is missing what's happening -- they loved music and they're missing these great records that come out, and they're missing these shows that they would've wanted to go to. It just threw me for a loop to know that life is so fragile." Palehound's first release for Polyvinyl is also about the light that gradually dawns after tragedy, with songs like the bass-heavy "Room" and the gentle dreamy album closer "At Night I'm Alright With You" feeling their way through blossoming love. "The album is also about learning how to find love, honestly, after loss," says Kempner. Since forming in 2014, Palehound -- Kempner, drummer Jesse Weiss (Spook The Herd), and new bassist Larz Brogan (a veteran of Boston DIY who, Kempner posits, "had 13 local bands last year") -- have taken their plainspoken, technique-heavy indie rock from the basements of Boston to festivals around the world. A Place I'll Always Go was recorded in late 2016 at the Brooklyn complex Thump Studios with the assistance of Gabe Wax, who recorded Dry Food. "I would put my life in his hands," Kempner asserts. "I trust him so much." A Place I'll Always Go builds on the promise of Palehound's critically acclaimed 2015 album Dry Food with songs that are slightly more reserved, but no less powerful. "Flowing Over" rides a sweetly hooky guitar line, with Kempner using the fuzzed-out upper register of her voice as a sort of anxious counterpoint to the riff's infectious melody. "That song is about anxiety," says Kempner, "and when you're sad and you listen to sad music to feed it and feel yourself spinning all these 'what if's and 'I'm terrible's in your head." "This record represents a period of time in my life way more than anything I've ever written before," says Kempner, who notes that the swirling "If You Met Her" and the piano-tinged "At Night I'm Alright With You" could represent the opposing poles of the record. "One of them is about love, and the other one is about death -- it was a really healthy experience for me to find my own dialogue within that," she says. "There's so much that you learn and read, and other people's experiences that you internalize, that you try to then base your own on. It was helpful to carve my own path for that." Part of what makes A Place I'll Always Go so striking is the way it channels feelings of anxiety -- heart-racing moments both exhilarating and crushing -- into songs that feel well-worn and comforting. The hushed confessionalism of "Carnations" and the fugue state described in the stripped-down "Feeling Fruit" are snapshots of moments marked by big, confusing feelings, but they're taken with compassion and honesty -- two qualities that have defined Palehound's music from the beginning. Boy Scouts https://taylorvick.bandcamp.com https://twitter.com/boyscoutsband Tim Woulfe https://timwoulfe.bandcamp.com clam lust

Palehound, Tim Woulfe, Boy Scouts, clam lust

Saturday, March 3, 2018

6:00PM

The Dock

Ithaca, NY

9
147696726032351

Palehound, Tim Woulfe, Boy Scouts, clam lust

Saturday, March 3, 2018 6:00PM - Sunday, March 4, 2018 12:00AM

Ithaca Underground and DSP Shows present: *PLEASE NOTE NEW DOOR/SHOW TIMES* 6:00PM Doors 7:00PM Show Palehound - Boston, MA https://www.palehound.com/ Boston‚Äôs Palehound, lead by fierce vocalist and prolific creative force Ellen Kempner, has announced the sophomore album "A Place I'll Always Go", to be released June 16 on Polyvinyl Record Co. The collection is a frank look at love and loss, cushioned by indelible hooks and gently propulsive, fuzzed-out rock. As Kempner explains, "A lot of it is about loss and learning how to let yourself evolve past the pain and the weird guilt that comes along with grief." Since forming in 2014, Palehound‚ÄîKempner, drummer Jesse Weiss (Spook The Herd), and new bassist Larz Brogan‚Äîhave taken their plainspoken, technique-heavy indie rock from the basements of Boston to festivals around the world. A Place I'll Always Go builds on the promise of Palehound's critically acclaimed 2015 album Dry Food with songs that breathe Kempner‚Äôs evolved maturity, while asserting her core artistic fire. A Place I'll Always Go, which channels feelings of anxiety ‚Äî heart-racing moments both exhilarating and crushing ‚Äî into songs that feel well-worn and comforting. Tim Woulfe - Philadelphia, PA https://timwoulfe.bandcamp.com A focused, painterly approach can be found throughout Philadelphian musician Tim Woulfe‚Äôs discography. Woulfe builds each track from the ground up with field recordings, nylon guitars, vocal harmonies and whatever else happens to be lying around the room at the time. These many layers make the songs feel human and lived in, a distinctly personal and stabilizing attempt at embodying stillness and softness in an often harsh and overwhelming world. As past comparisons to Arthur Russell and Mount Eerie have pointed out, there is no set sound or style to Woulfe‚Äôs music, just a never ending exploration of everyday living through sound and song. Boy Scouts - San Francisco, CA https://taylorvick.bandcamp.com Warm guitars work alongside Taylor Vick‚Äôs sweetly layered vocals and light harmonies to bring us the Bay-Area-born, indie bliss that is Boy Scouts. Whether an emotional swell or a calm confession, Vick‚Äôs melodies and modest lyrics stand out in comfort. clam lust - Ithaca, NY Clever lo-fi electro-pop from duel bass and synth player Claire McClusky of Slumbers and Rill Ghosties. 6 PM DOORS - 7 PM SHOW - ALL AGES - $12.50 - SAFE SPACE

Root Shock

Root Shock formed in 2012 with regional veteran musicians whose love of reggae music flows deep. Their unique blend of reggae and heavy drum & bass combined with American roots and soul, and a focus on conscious lyrics result in positive dance music will make you want to move! The band has been surprising and delighting crowds across the New York region and beyond, bringing their unique high-energy style spearheaded by the stunning soulful vocals and stage presence of Jessica Brown to a wide range of settings. The band‚Äôs dedication to spreading music with a positive message has paid off in entertaining, elevating, and energizing music lovers of all walks of life! On the heels of their 2016 debut album, Root Shock is stepping up their game, hitting the road and bringing their renowned live show to clubs, festivals and concert halls far and wide. The band is concentrating on spreading their uplifting message and vibes to the masses. Root Shock‚Äôs genre-bending sound has proven to fit many musical settings yet always stand out! Root Shock is: Jessica Brown - Vocals & Melodica Bill Eppel ‚Äì Bass Guitar Cix Nyne ‚Äì Drums & Vocals Phil Grajko ‚Äì Guitar & Vocals Nick Kaczmar ‚Äì Keyboards Jason ‚ÄúJocko‚Äù Randall ‚Äì Percussion, Electronics & Vocals Dan Valvassori ‚Äì Guitar Tickets: $5

Soule Monde with Brickdrop at Nectar's

Saturday, March 3, 2018

9:00PM

Nectar's

Burlington, VT

9
429267540821121

Soule Monde with Brickdrop at Nectar's

Saturday, March 3, 2018 9:00PM - Sunday, March 4, 2018 12:00AM

Sponsored by Lost Nation Brewing 9pm doors 21+ ‚Ä¢ $7 ADV // $7 DOS ~~~~~~~~~~ Soule Monde (Ray Paczkowski & Russ Lawton) Soule Monde is avant funk erupting from the syncopated minds of power drummer Russ Lawton + B3 wizard Ray Paczkowski. An ideal union of swagger and raw talent, the duo is fervently cemented into an indestructible pocket, where bold improvisational leaps by either player are met by a near-telepathic response from the other. This is fluid funk, crafted for the dance floor but supported by an extensive grasp of jazz improvisation. Members of Soule Monde have appeared at Bonnaroo, Austin City Limits, on Saturday Night Live, David Letterman, Jay Leno, Conan O'Brien and Jimmy Fallon, and have shared the stage with Carlos Santana, Rolling Stones, Trey Anastasio, Dave Matthews, Victor Wooten, Mike Gordon, Viperhouse + Strangefolk. Ray and Russ are both current touring members of Trey Anastasio Band. Brickdrop Brickdrop is high impact blast of up-tempo dance, funk, jazz, r&b with a rock attitude. The music weaves between moments of intricate syncopated melodies, and free flowing fusion grooves reminiscent of the 70's Herbie Hancock era. It is an equal blend of intentional design and spontaneous artistic creation. Whether you like to party, or listen the music is sure to hit you like a brick.

Matt and Kim at The Haunt

Matt and Kim at The Haunt

DSP Shows Presents Matt and kim + Fletcher C. Johnson at The Haunt on 3/7!! *Language not suitable for all ages* 7:00pm Doors 8:00pm Show Matt and kim http://mattandkimmusic.com/ For many bands, making music is all about the routine of recording an annual album, or being able to tour in progressively bigger venues. Not Matt and Kim. "Our goal is to make music we want to hear," says Matt Johnson, who co-founded the band with Kim Schifino. "When it comes time to make a new album, I'm just so excited, since I know we have all these ideas and I just want to get them out there." As for the band's extra-emphatic live shows, which these days happen in large venues, he explains, "We've always just really enjoyed playing music, and things have kept growing."

Troy Millette Solo

7-9pm All Ages // Free ~~~~~~~~~~~ Troy Millette Music Heart, humor, and humility are keys to success for Fairfax singer/songwriter Troy Millette, whose energetic live performances have earned him a reputation as one of Vermont‚Äôs must-see artists. Drawing from a wide array of contemporary and retro cover tunes, as well as a vast catalogue of original material, his sets are sure to entertain music-lovers of all types. Over the past several years Millette has continued to hone his craft playing across Vermont and upstate New York. As a result of his talent and determination, Millette has shared the stage with some of the most talented names in the business including local favorites Madaila and Kat Wright & the Indomitable Soul Band, as well as national recording artists such as Atlantic Records Oh Honey!, country music balladeer Jamie Lee Thurston, and Noah Guthrie of the hit FOX Television series ‚Äòglee‚Äô.

Chefs: The Sizzling Kitchen Showdown

Thursday, March 8, 2018

8:00PM

State Theatre of Ithaca

Ithaca, NY

9
922186551292308

Chefs: The Sizzling Kitchen Showdown

Thursday, March 8, 2018 8:00PM

The CFCU Community Credit Union and Gateway Commons Community Series Presents: Chefs: The Sizzling Kitchen Showdown Thursday, March 8th, 2018 8pm showtime Feast your eyes on CHEFS! These hilarious (and delicious) hunks give you a peek behind the apron as they slice, dice, and spice things up in the kitchen through a series of escalating culinary challenges where the stakes are high: if they lose a challenge, they lose their shirt. Literally. CHEFS is a fully interactive experience where you will vote for the winner and may even join the boiling hot chefs on-stage for uproarious cooking demonstrations. Outrageously bold and hysterically funny, CHEFS is too hot for TV, making it the perfect night out!

Guitarist and Singer, Johnny Nicholas--Live

Thursday, March 8, 2018

8:00PM

Abilene Bar and Lounge

Rochester, NY

9
346559325823837

Guitarist and Singer, Johnny Nicholas--Live

Thursday, March 8, 2018 8:00PM - Thursday, March 8, 2018 11:00PM

Don't miss former Asleep at the Wheel guitarist and R&B singer/guitarist, JOHNNY NICHOLAS! Make no mistake: Johnny Nicholas knows from the blues. His credentials? Impeccable. Conviction? Immeasurable. And chops? If an instrument‚Äôs got strings, keys, or reeds he can play the hell out of it. He‚Äôs also a consummate songwriter and a great singer blessed with a warm, toasty growl of a voice that can roll from rumble to croon and back again with seductive ease. Marcia Ball calls Nicholas ‚Äúan extremely engaging innovative traditionalist‚Äù who ‚Äúwrites instant classics and sings them to break your heart and rock your soul.‚Äù But the key word there is ‚Äúinnovative,‚Äù because as deep as his roots go ‚Äî and we‚Äôre talking about a cat who learned firsthand from the likes of Robert Lockwood Jr., Howlin‚Äô Wolf, Big Walter Horton, and Johnny Shines (to name but a few of the legends he studied under early in his five-decade career) ‚Äî Nicholas does not paint in one color. As befits a soul who‚Äôs spent a lifetime soaking up the flavor of such vibrant music scenes as Ann Arbor, Chicago, South Louisiana and Texas (which he‚Äôs called home now for nearly 40 years), his music is full-spectrum Americana ‚Äî a rich gumbo of not just blues, but cajun, swing, folk, and barrelhouse rock ‚Äôn‚Äô roll. As an artist and performer he can mesmerize a listening room crowd or bring a festival crowd to their feet with his rollicking boogie woogie piano and his stellar band. For proof, just take a listen to Nicholas‚Äô most satisfyingly eclectic collection of original American roots music yet, 2016‚Äôs Fresh Air, which finds him drawing on all of the above and deep into his soul for words of wit, wisdom, and heart. As the esteemed writer Bill Bentley puts it best, ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs someone who cares about being real, and the hell with everything else ‚Ä¶ .‚Äù http://johnnynicholasblues.com/

23rd Annual Magic Hat Mardi Gras Weekend

Friday, March 9, 2018

7:00PM

Magic Hat Brewing Company

South Burlington, VT

9
1913832021963650

23rd Annual Magic Hat Mardi Gras Weekend

Friday, March 9, 2018 7:00PM - Sunday, March 11, 2018 8:00PM

The 23rd annual Magic Hat Mardi Gras Weekend is scheduled to go down Thursday, March 8 to Sunday, March 11! We're planning the most epic Mardi Gras Weekend we've ever had, full of dozens of live shows throughout Burlington and the Grand Parade on Saturday at 3pm. Mardi Gras serves to benefit the Vermont Foodbank, and we're aiming to make it easier than ever for you to help out Vermonters in need. Weekend plans are coming together! Here's what to expect as of right now: -Friday, March 9 @ 5pm: The The High Breaks at the Magic Hat Artifactory. -Friday, March 9 @ 7pm: Mardi Gras Kick-Off show at Higher Ground, featuring Dumpstaphunk! -Friday, March 9 @ 9pm: Magic Hat Mardi Gras presents: Reel Big Fish at Club Metronome. -Saturday, March 10 @ 10am-1pm: Kegs & Eggs with the HIGH & MIGHTY BRASS BAND. -Saturday, March 10 @ 3pm: The GRAND PARADE of floats rolls down Main St., downtown Burlington, VT. -Saturday, March 10 @ 4pm: Magic Hat Mardi Gras presents: An Evening with Lotus at Club Metronome. Plus, live music, beer and food specials everywhere in downtown Burlington, all weekend long! Visit https://www.magichat.net/mardigras/ for more info!

Free Music Happy Hour with Julia Felice and the Whiskey Crisis

Friday, March 9, 2018

6:00PM

The Dock

Ithaca, NY

9
1312710628875146

Free Music Happy Hour with Julia Felice and the Whiskey Crisis

Friday, March 9, 2018 6:00PM - Friday, March 9, 2018 8:00PM

Julia Felice and the Whiskey Crisis is a soul rock band from Ithaca, NY. Julia Felice and Harry Nichols first set out to record a five song EP in the Spring of 2011. Their initial results inspired Nichols and Felice to start over and instead create a full LP of originals, some of which were the first Felice had ever written. The final album, Diving for Falls, was released in December 2014. For the release show, they assembled the band that would eventually come to call themselves The Whiskey Crisis: Julian Dalton on drums, Samuel B. Lupowitz on bass, and Joe Massa on lead guitar.

9:30PM

Flour City Station

Soule Monde at Waterhole Music Lounge, Saranac Lake, NY

Friday, March 9, 2018

9:00PM

Waterhole

Saranac Lake, NY

9
673720709683761

Soule Monde at Waterhole Music Lounge, Saranac Lake, NY

Friday, March 9, 2018 9:00PM - Saturday, March 10, 2018 1:00AM

Soule Monde (Russ Lawton + Ray Paczkowski) Members of Trey Anastasio Band Waterhole Music Lounge 48 Main St., Saranac Lake, NY 8pm Doors 9pm Show - $10.00- 21+ www.saranaclakewaterhole.com Soule Monde - Burlington, VT http://www.soulemonde.com/ Instrumental Funk from Drum + Hammond B3 Power Duo Russ Lawton + Ray Paczkowski Soule Monde is avant funk erupting from the syncopated minds of power drummer Russ Lawton + B3 wizard Ray Paczkowski. An ideal union of swagger and raw talent, the duo is fervently cemented into an indestructible pocket, where bold improvisational leaps by either player are met by a near-telepathic response from the other. This is fluid funk, crafted for the dance floor but supported by an extensive grasp of jazz improvisation. Members of Soule Monde have appeared at Bonnaroo, Austin City Limits, on Saturday Night Live, David Letterman, Jay Leno, Conan O'Brien and Jimmy Fallon, and have shared the stage with Carlos Santana, Rolling Stones, Trey Anastasio, Dave Matthews, Victor Wooten, Mike Gordon, Viperhouse + Strangefolk. Ray and Russ are both current touring members of Trey Anastasio Band.

Dave Matthews Tribute - Big Eyed Phish at Westcott Theater

Saturday, March 10, 2018

7:00PM

The Westcott Theater

Syracuse, NY

9
194030614526150

Dave Matthews Tribute - Big Eyed Phish at Westcott Theater

Saturday, March 10, 2018 7:00PM - Saturday, March 10, 2018 11:30PM

Big Eyed Phish - The Dave Matthews Tribute Band - returns to Syracuse for a show at The Westcott Theater. Doors are at 7pm with opening band (TBD) taking the stage at 8pm. Big Eyed Phish will take the stage after that and provide 2 hours of your favorite classic and deep cut DMB tracks, along with some of the newer material that the band has come out with over the last few years. Big Eyed Phish is the only regionally touring full 7-piece Dave Matthews Tribute in the country and are based out of Rochester, NY. In the 8 years they have been performing together, they have grown to become a highly sought-after headlining act for festivals, resorts, casinos, and live music venues. The band is lead by frontman Brandon Depaul, the founder of the former DMB Tribute: Tripping Billies. He is backed up by a great band of truly professional musicians and is the only DMB Tribute that can claim to have a full time lead guitar and keyboard player. This allows them to be the only accurate DMB Tribute in the country able to cover the full spectrum of the DMB catalog throughout the lineup changes seen in the Dave Matthews Band. Members include: Brandon DePaul ("Dave") - Lead Vocals, Guitar Jimmy Grillo ("Carter") - Drums Dan Merkey ("Jeff/LeRoi") - Sax, Backup Vocals, Cowbell Shawn Rotolo ("Stefan") - Bass Mike Hoeschele ("Boyd") - Violin, Harmonica, Backup Vocals Brian Dudiak ("Butch") - Keyboards Jon Sheffer ("Tim") - Lead Guitar (Kire Najdovski and Collin Jones sub on lead guitar at times) Big Eyed Phish has continued to be one of the most sought-after DMB tribute acts in the country. Each show is unique with a blend of mega-hits to dance to as well as some deep tracks for the more dedicated DMB fanbase. There are over 75 songs in their catalog combining Dave Matthews Band's original tunes as well as some songs that DMB is known to cover. The live show is a high-energy driven audio and visual experience intending to immerse the audience in a feeling of seeing and hearing the real band, while enjoying the more intimate nature of tribute band performances. The band is often hired for headline slots and given top billing as a nationally touring act. Dave Matthews Band's music is enjoyed by a wide range of ages and musical tastes, crossing over into many different genres including rock, blues, country, soul, jazz, and more. This band gives much more than just a recreation of the songs from an album, and focuses their efforts to truly put on a show that mirrors the Dave Matthews Band live experience. From the incredible musicianship, the soulful lyrics, the rocking solos and jams, and even the witty stage banter Dave Matthews is known for - Big Eyed Phish delivers on all aspects. When looking for the DMB Tribute that is able to offer the full catalog of the Dave Matthews Band sound throughout the years - Big Eyed Phish is the best there is. From private parties, to weddings, to festivals, concert series, casinos, resorts, and large live music venues - this band will leave people saying "I feel like I just left a live Dave Matthews show".
